title: 111_s1798
content: The Act titled "Automatic Reserve Component Enrollment Act of 2009" mandates automatic enrollment of demobilizing National Guard and Reserve members in health care and dental care programs of the Department of Veterans Affairs. The "Automatic Reserve Component Enrollment Act of 2009" requires the Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to automatically enroll National Guard and Reserve members in VA health and dental care programs during demobilization and discharge. Privacy protections for members' personal information must be ensured during enrollment activities. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must provide assistance to National Guard and Reserve members during demobilization and discharge for enrollment in VA health and dental care programs. This assistance includes help with completing required enrollment activities and education and outreach efforts. During demobilization and discharge, the Department of Defense personnel must provide information to National Guard and Reserve members about eligible programs and benefits. The Secretary of Defense ensures adequate facilities and resources for enrollment activities during the demobilization process. During demobilization and discharge, the Department of Defense must provide information to National Guard and Reserve members about eligible programs and benefits. The Secretary of Defense ensures facilities and resources for enrollment activities. Nothing in this section mandates participation in health or dental care programs. The Secretaries of Defense and Veterans Affairs must submit annual reports on implementation to specified committees. The report required by the Secretaries of Defense and Veterans Affairs to specified committees shall include activities undertaken, assessment of effects on enrollment in health and dental care programs for veterans, and participation of Reserve components of the Armed Forces. The report will assess the budgetary impact and demand for services on the Department of Veterans Affairs, recommend legislative or administrative actions to improve enrollment of Reserve components in health and dental care programs for veterans, and address other relevant matters. In this section, the term "enrollment" refers to collecting and recording information about a Reserve component member of the Armed Forces in the Department of Veterans Affairs' record-keeping system to facilitate their participation in health or dental care programs for veterans if they choose to participate and are eligible.
